about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: You should use your horn when:

about.name: You should use your horn when:

hasPart.assesses: You should use your horn when: | You should use your horn when: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Only use your horn when it is necessary to avoid collisions. Do not use your horn if a driver or bicyclist is moving slowly and you want him or her to drive faster or get out of your way.

suggestedAnswer.text: Another vehicle is in your way.

comment.text: Another vehicle is in your way.

suggestedAnswer.text: It may help prevent a collision.

comment.text: It may help prevent a collision.
Another driver makes a mistake.

acceptedAnswer.text: It may help prevent a collision.

comment.text: It may help prevent a collision.

answerExplanation.text: Only use your horn when it is necessary to avoid collisions. Do not use your horn if a driver or bicyclist is moving slowly and you want him or her to drive faster or get out of your way.

comment.text: You should use your horn when: | Only use your horn when it is necessary to avoid collisions. Do not use your horn if a driver or bicyclist is moving slowly and you want him or her to drive faster or get out of your way.

hasPart.name: If you have had several beers, the effects of alcohol will be reduced only by:

about.name: If you have had several beers, the effects of alcohol will be reduced only by:

hasPart.assesses: If you have had several beers, the effects of alcohol will be reduced only by: | If you have had several beers, the effects of alcohol will be reduced only by: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: The only way to remove the impairing effects of alcohol is to give the body time to remove it from the body. Drinking coffee, physical activity, or taking a cold shower will not speed up this process. It takes about one hour to cancel the effects of one drink.

comment.text: Taking a cold shower.
Waiting several hours.
Drinking several cups of coffee.
Waiting several hours.

answerExplanation.text: The only way to remove the impairing effects of alcohol is to give the body time to remove it from the body. Drinking coffee, physical activity, or taking a cold shower will not speed up this process. It takes about one hour to cancel the effects of one drink.

comment.text: If you have had several beers, the effects of alcohol will be reduced only by: | The only way to remove the impairing effects of alcohol is to give the body time to remove it from the body. Drinking coffee, physical activity, or taking a cold shower will not speed up this process. It takes about one hour to cancel the effects of one drink.

hasPart.name: If your vehicle starts to lose traction because of water on the road, you should:

about.name: If your vehicle starts to lose traction because of water on the road, you should:

hasPart.assesses: If your vehicle starts to lose traction because of water on the road, you should: | If your vehicle starts to lose traction because of water on the road, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When driving in heavy rain at speeds as low as 30 mph, your tires may lose all contact with the road and instead ride up on a layer of water above the surface of the road. This is called "hydroplaning." If your vehicle starts to hydroplane, slow down gradually and do not apply the brakes.

suggestedAnswer.text: Drive at a constant speed to gain better traction.

comment.text: Drive at a constant speed to gain better traction.

suggestedAnswer.text: Apply the brakes firmly to prevent your vehicle from sliding.

comment.text: Apply the brakes firmly to prevent your vehicle from sliding.

suggestedAnswer.text: Slow down gradually and not apply the brakes.

comment.text: Slow down gradually and not apply the brakes.

acceptedAnswer.text: Slow down gradually and not apply the brakes.

comment.text: Slow down gradually and not apply the brakes.

answerExplanation.text: When driving in heavy rain at speeds as low as 30 mph, your tires may lose all contact with the road and instead ride up on a layer of water above the surface of the road. This is called "hydroplaning." If your vehicle starts to hydroplane, slow down gradually and do not apply the brakes.

comment.text: If your vehicle starts to lose traction because of water on the road, you should: | When driving in heavy rain at speeds as low as 30 mph, your tires may lose all contact with the road and instead ride up on a layer of water above the surface of the road. This is called "hydroplaning." If your vehicle starts to hydroplane, slow down gradually and do not apply the brakes.

hasPart.name: When changing lanes, you should never:

about.name: When changing lanes, you should never:

hasPart.assesses: When changing lanes, you should never: | When changing lanes, you should never: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When changing lanes, you must be sure that there are no vehicles in the space you want to enter. Check for other vehicles behind and to the side of your vehicle by checking your mirrors and blind spots. Always use the proper turn signal before changing lanes to allow surrounding vehicles time to react to your movements.

suggestedAnswer.text: Look over your shoulder to check your blind spot.

comment.text: Look over your shoulder to check your blind spot.
Change lanes abruptly or spontaneously.

suggestedAnswer.text: Check for other vehicles moving into the same lane.

comment.text: Check for other vehicles moving into the same lane.
Change lanes abruptly or spontaneously.

answerExplanation.text: When changing lanes, you must be sure that there are no vehicles in the space you want to enter. Check for other vehicles behind and to the side of your vehicle by checking your mirrors and blind spots. Always use the proper turn signal before changing lanes to allow surrounding vehicles time to react to your movements.

comment.text: When changing lanes, you should never: | When changing lanes, you must be sure that there are no vehicles in the space you want to enter. Check for other vehicles behind and to the side of your vehicle by checking your mirrors and blind spots. Always use the proper turn signal before changing lanes to allow surrounding vehicles time to react to your movements.

hasPart.text: When making a left turn from a one-way street onto a two-way street, start from the far left lane.

comment.text: The far left lane.
Any available lane.

suggestedAnswer.text: The lane closest to the middle of the street.

comment.text: The lane closest to the middle of the street.
The far left lane.

answerExplanation.text: When making a left turn from a one-way street onto a two-way street, start from the far left lane.
